key_features.subtitle: Key Features
key_features.heading: MiraQuery combines powerful AI with a robust, developer-friendly architecture to make data access effortless and universal.
key_features.lead: Discover how it transforms your daily data interactions!

ai_powered.title: AI-Powered Natural Language Querying
ai_powered.description: Mira transforms natural language into precise SQL or MongoDB queries using xAI's Grok API. Its interpreter simplifies complex database interactions, making data access intuitive for all users, from beginners to experts.
ai_powered.case_example: A manager asks: "Show me all orders from 2025."
ai_powered.result: Mira generates: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date >= '2025-01-01';
ai_powered.additional_point: Contextual Accuracy: Mira understands query intent with high precision, ensuring reliable results without manual query crafting.

multi_database.title: Multi-Database Support & Optimization
multi_database.description: Mira supports PostgreSQL and MongoDB with AI-driven schema creation, query optimization, and caching. It introspects schemas, optimizes database structures, and caches results in Redis for sub-50ms latency.
multi_database.case_example: A retailer queries: "Sales by product category this year."
multi_database.result: Mira optimizes: SELECT category, SUM(sales) FROM orders GROUP BY category; with cached results for instant access.
multi_database.additional_point: Performance Boost: Automatic schema generation and query optimization reduce database load and improve response times.

developer_friendly.title: Developer-Friendly APIs & ORM Integration
developer_friendly.description: Mira offers simple and enriched REST APIs (internal/external) and an ORM-like SDK (@korva/mira) for seamless integration. Developers can query databases in natural language or use structured APIs with Zod validation and NeverThrow error handling.
developer_friendly.case_example: A developer integrates Mira into a web app.
developer_friendly.result: Code: import mira from '@korva/mira'; mira.query('List active users');
developer_friendly.additional_point: Flexibility: Public database support and ORM-like APIs simplify integration while maintaining security and scalability.

robust_monitoring.title: Robust Monitoring, Security & Caching
robust_monitoring.description: Mira provides comprehensive logging, monitoring, and caching with MongoDB logs and Redis cache. It ensures secure query execution with validated inputs and offers insights into performance and usage patterns.
robust_monitoring.case_example: An admin checks query performance after a peak usage period.
robust_monitoring.result: Logs show: Query ID: 456, Time: 42ms, Status: Cached, Security: Validated.
robust_monitoring.additional_point: Proactive Insights: Real-time monitoring and security features protect data while optimizing performance with intelligent caching.

how_it_works.subtitle: How It Works
how_it_works.heading: Discover how Mira transforms your words into actionable data.

input_query.title: Input Your Query in Plain Language
input_query.description: Start by typing a natural language request. Mira’s AI, powered by xAI’s Grok API, interprets your intent, capturing context to prepare for query generation.
input_query.case_example: A user types: "Find all customers who bought in 2025."
input_query.result: Mira parses: Intent = select customers, condition = purchase year 2025.
input_query.additional_point: Effortless Start: No need for technical query knowledge—just describe what you want.

analyze_schema.title: Analyze and Optimize Database Schema
analyze_schema.description: Mira introspects your database (PostgreSQL or MongoDB), creates or caches an optimized schema in JSON, and prepares an efficient query plan tailored to your data structure.
analyze_schema.case_example: Mira processes the request on a sales database.
analyze_schema.result: Mira caches: { table: "customers", columns: ["id", "purchase_date"] } and optimizes query structure.
analyze_schema.additional_point: Smart Setup: Schema creation and optimization ensure fast, accurate query generation.

generate_queries.title: Generate and Execute Secure Queries
generate_queries.description: Mira converts the request into a secure SQL or MongoDB query, validates inputs, executes it, and caches results in Redis for instant future access, with logs stored in MongoDB.
generate_queries.result: Mira runs: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE purchase_date >= '2025-01-01'; caches result, logs: Query ID: 101, Time: 45ms.
generate_queries.additional_point: Safe & Fast: Security checks and caching deliver reliable results with sub-50ms latency.

deliver_results.title: Deliver Results via API or App
deliver_results.description: Mira returns query results through a REST API (POST /query) or ORM-like SDK (@korva/mira), enabling seamless integration into apps or direct access via the SaaS platform.
deliver_results.case_example: A developer retrieves results in a web app.
deliver_results.result: Code: import mira from '@korva/mira'; const data = await mira.query('Find all customers who bought in 2025');
deliver_results.additional_point: Flexible Output: Supports internal/external APIs and public databases for versatile use.

faq.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.heading: Do you have questions about MiraQuery? We have the answers!

items.question: What is MiraQuery?
items.answer: MiraQuery is a TypeScript backend engine that transforms your natural language queries into executable SQL or MongoDB commands. It uses xAI's Grok API to understand and generate these queries, simplifying access and analysis of your data for everyone.

items.question: Which databases does MiraQuery support?
items.answer: Currently, MiraQuery supports PostgreSQL and MongoDB. We use official and lightweight drivers for these two databases, with schema introspection to ensure generated queries are precise and adapted to your data structure.

items.question: What AI technology does MiraQuery use?
items.answer: MiraQuery relies exclusively on xAI's Grok API for artificial intelligence. This allows us to delegate computational load and benefit from Grok's advanced capabilities for precise natural language to query conversion.

items.question: Is MiraQuery fast?
items.answer: Yes, MiraQuery is designed for performance. Thanks to a Redis cache (ioredis), results from frequent queries are served in less than 50 ms. Additionally, connection pools managed by underlying Node.js drivers help reduce latency.

items.question: How does MiraQuery ensure security and robustness?
items.answer: MiraQuery is built on a 100% TypeScript stack, ensuring robustness and strict typing. We use Zod for typed and secure input validation, and NeverThrow for robust and predictable error management.

items.question: How can I integrate MiraQuery into my application?
items.answer: MiraQuery offers several integration options: a powerful REST API (POST /query route), an npm package @korva/mira (client-side SDK) to simplify API calls, and Swagger/OpenAPI documentation with an interactive UI interface (/docs) to facilitate testing and API exploration.

items.question: Can I deploy MiraQuery on my own servers (On-Premise)?
items.answer: Absolutely! In addition to the SaaS platform and API service, MiraQuery offers a containerized version via Docker (with Helm charts) for companies with strict security and compliance requirements.

items.question: Is there a free version of MiraQuery?
items.answer: Yes, we offer a Freemium tier that allows you to perform up to 50 queries per month for free. This gives you the opportunity to test MiraQuery and discover its power before upgrading to a paid plan.

items.question: What future features are planned for MiraQuery?
items.answer: We plan a data warehouse for analytical queries, an integrated chatbot (Slack, Teams, WhatsApp), integration of vector databases (e.g., Milvus), a Model Context Protocol (MCP), custom prompts, query pipelines, and monitoring tools with intelligent recommendations.

items.question: How does MiraQuery differ from other Text2SQL tools?
items.answer: MiraQuery stands out with its versatility (SQL and NoSQL), developer-oriented approach (TypeScript stack, npm SDK, Swagger), superior performance thanks to Redis cache, and robust architecture. Our ecosystem vision with ambitious future plans (DW, chatbot, vector bases) makes it a complete and scalable solution.
